thread.title: Bills-Jaguars recap: Highlights, videos, analysis, scoring, more from London
thread.title_full: Bills-Jaguars recap: Highlights, videos, analysis, scoring, more from London

author: Matthew Fairburn | mfairburn@syracuse.com
title: Bills-Jaguars recap: Highlights, videos, analysis, scoring, more from London
text:
Jaguars 34, Bills 31 
By Matthew Fairburn and The Associated Press 
London â€” Blake Bortles threw a touchdown pass to Allen Hurns with 2:16 remaining and the Jacksonville Jaguars rallied for a 34-31 win over Buffalo Bills on Sunday at Wembley Stadium. 
Bortles' second TD pass of the game came a short time after Buffalo safety Corey Graham intercepted a pass and returned it 44 yards to put the Bills ahead. 
The Jaguars (2-5) won their first game in London after losing in each of the past two seasons at Wembley, the home of England's national soccer team. The Bills (3-4) were playing in the British capital for the first time. 
EJ Manuel started at quarterback for the Bills for the second straight game in the absence of the injured Tyrod Taylor. 
Manuel's early struggles allowed Jacksonville to take a big lead, but Manuel led the rally until the Jaguars took the lead for good in the final minutes. 
Photos by The Associated Press Matthew Fairburn's observations 
EJ Manuel, the quarterback the Bills felt strongly enough about to trade away backup quarterback Matt Cassel just over a month ago, had the worst quarter any quarterback has had this season. ... Needless to say, the Bills could use Tyrod Taylor back after the bye week. 
More from Matthew Fairburn MVP: Allen Hurns 
Blake Bortles deserves credit for leading the touchdown drive that won the Jaguars the game, but wide receiver Allen Hurns made an outstanding play on the diving grab. In a game that was filled with mistakes and sloppy play, no single player had a banner performance. Hurns made the critical play and gets the game ball by default. Biggest disappointment: EJ Manuel 
EJ Manuel turned the ball over like a mad man in the first half. He may have finished with 298 yards, two touchdowns and two interceptions, but all three of his first-half turnovers led to touchdowns. Two of them were directly returned for touchdowns. The Bills almost overcame it, but Manuel dug too much of a hole. Thought the @jaguars were done? This Bortles/Hurns TD would like a word with you.
